items.description: River Wandle area in the London Boroughs of Wandsworth, Merton, Lambeth, Croydon and Sutton
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Croydon, Greater London, Lambeth, Merton, Sutton, Wandsworth

items.message:
Rising river levels overnight may lead to flooding.
Flooding is possible when river levels are at their highest  between the early hours of the morning until Saturday afternoon on 19/07/2025.
Further rainfall is forecast for the next 48 hours and water levels will remain elevated.
We are closely monitoring the situation and liaising with emergency services and local authorities.
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses.
Don't put yourself or others at risk.
This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 19/07/2025, or as the situation changes.

This flood alert has been issued as heavy rain and thunderstorms have been forecast for this area over the weekend. There is uncertainty over the amount of rainfall expected and the exact location of the thunderstorms and heavy rain . River and surface water flooding may affect these areas. We urge you to remain vigilant and avoid walking and driving through flood water. We are continuing to actively monitor the situation closely and will issue updates, and further flood alerts and warnings if necessary. You can monitor your local weather conditions and river levels on the GOV.UK website.

floodArea.county: Barnet, Enfield, Essex, Greater London, Haringey, Hertfordshire, Redbridge, Waltham Forest
floodArea.riverOrSea: Ching Brook, Cobbins Brook, Nazeing Brook, Pymmes Brook, Salmons Brook, Turkey Brook, Small River Lee, Rags Brook, Trinity Marsh Ditch

items.message:
Rain overnight tonight will cause river levels to rise tomorrow morning, Saturday 19th July 2025.
Flooding is possible when river levels are at their highest.
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Rags Brook; Nazeing Brook; Small River Lee; Theobolds Brook; Cobbins Brook; Small River Lee; Turkey Brook; Salmons Brook; Pymmes Brook; Ching Brook.
Further rain is forecast for Saturday, and flooding is possible throughout the day. 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses.
We will continue to monitor the situation and this message will be updated by 11:30 AM on Saturday 19th July 2025, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: Barking and Dagenham, Essex, Greater London, Havering

items.message:
Rain overnight tonight will cause river levels to rise tomorrow morning, Saturday 19th July 2025. 
Flooding is possible when river levels are at their highest.
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Rom; Beam, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around Abbotts Close; Como Street.
Further rain is forecast for Saturday, and flooding is possible throughout the day. 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses.
We will continue to monitor the situation and this message will be updated by 11:30 AM on 19th July 2025, or as the situation changes.
